translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Fruits
The Elder Kuṭajapuppha’s Story
“Not far from the Himalayas,
there is a mountain named Vasala;
The Buddha named Sudassana,
was living in the middle of the mountain.
Taking a golden flower,
I went through the air;🔽There I saw the Sambuddha,
who had crossed over the flood, who was without pollutants.
Taking a kuṭaja flower,
placing it on my head, with my hands in añjali,
I scattered it over the Buddha,
the Great Seer who had arisen by himself.
In the past, thirty-one eons ago,
the flower I worshipped with;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My pollutants are destroyed,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Kuṭajapuppha recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kuṭajapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kuṭajapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kuṭajapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽kuṭajapupphiya therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The Elder Kuṭajapuppha’s Story is the seventh.
